comments.body: would be nice to add small java doc, it should be pretty obvious from name but doesn't hurt.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +31,35 @@   * Get the local directories that used by BlockManager to save the blocks to disk
   */
  def getLocalDiskDirs: Array[String]

  /**

comments.body: The block manager keeps RDD blocks as well, shall we support it? I think it's better to have a `def getHostLocalBlockData(blockId: BlockId, dirs: Array[String])`, to be consistent with `getLocalBlockData`. We can add an assert in `getHostLocalBlockData` to make sure the `blockId` is `ShuffleBlockId`, if we don't want to support RDD blocks now.

Disk persisted host-local RDD blocks are already supported for details see https://github.com/apache/spark/pull/25299.

I think using the exact type `ShuffleBlockId` here is better as it is checked by compile time and describes the intended usage of this method better. 

As SPARK-27651 is already merged I won't expect any upcoming change here regarding host local block access.
